text: IFC drawings, topographic survey, and geotechnical report reviewed
Site boundaries, setbacks, and elevation benchmarks confirmed and staked
Erosion and sediment control measures in place (silt fence, straw wattles, ditch checks)
Trees, brush, and debris removed per environmental and permit requirements
Topsoil stripped to approved depth and stockpiled separately with protection
Disposal of debris, root mat, and unsuitable material documented
Site rough graded to design contours within allowable tolerance (typically ±50 mm)
Subgrade compacted to 95% Standard Proctor (or per spec) and tested
Moisture content adjusted during compaction as per geo report
No overcut/undercut beyond tolerance unless approved by consultant

id: D. Subgrade Review and Drainage Prep

text: Subgrade prepared for pavement, concrete, or building pad with consistent slope
Drainage swales or subdrains placed prior to slab base if applicable
Subgrade reviewed by geotechnical engineer prior to base layer or structural fill
As-built grading plan submitted (or surveyed) to confirm design elevations
Erosion control maintained through final acceptance
